function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Misleading information and propaganda in the context of safe city projects","category":"Propaganda","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Privatization of data collection and delegation to third parties","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of data privacy and security in the collection and analysis of sensitive and personal data through iot and big data technologies","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standards for secure iot device integration and data exchange","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of control over data collected by private entities","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Public mistrust of private sector involvement in data management","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate data privacy and security measures in smart city infrastructure could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive medical information.","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy, control, and propaganda issues arising from the implementation of smart and safe city concepts.","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Security loopholes and threats posed by smart grid, automated building systems, unmanned aerial vehicles, and iot-enabled sensors.","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of data leading to espionage and financial exploitation","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear and discomfort among citizens due to surveillance and data privacy concerns","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneity of systems impacting trust in smart city concept","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consent for personal data processing in smart city systems","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance from the general public towards the coupling of smart city and safe city concepts.","category":"Community Engagement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential reliance on proprietary technology as an alternative to addressing privacy and security concerns in smart and safe cities.","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increased monitoring and management of human activities by corporate capitalism","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased dependence on digital platforms due to covid-19, leading to social and cultural reformation","category":"Community Engagement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proliferation of smart city technology and 6g may lead to increased surveillance and privacy concerns","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid advancements in ict and wireless technologies may result in disparities in digital access and broadband speeds","category":"Technology Access","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poor coverage in 1g technology","category":"Technology Access","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Low sound quality in 1g technology","category":"Technology Access","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of roaming support capacity in 1g technology","category":"Technology Access","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential health complications from 5g infrastructure installations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation related to the proliferation of social media and connectivity","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consistency in the definition of ’smart cities’ can lead to uncertainty and confusion in the implementation of smart city technologies and strategies, potentially hindering effective governance and urban development.","category":"Urban Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on private corporations for smart city development","category":"Corporate Influence","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surveillance and monitoring by corporations and governance entities","category":"Corporate Influence","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global cooperation and governance challenges in the face of corporate influence","category":"Corporate Influence","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monopolistic introduction of unique iot devices by corporations","category":"Corporate Influence","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Expensive infrastructure investment due to multiple device platforms","category":"Cost","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High implementation costs leading to abandonment or refocusing of the smart city pursuit","category":"Cost","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Major shift to at-home work and self-isolated society in developed countries","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequitable access to digital services and technologies, exacerbating urban inequalities and infrastructure issues.","category":"Inequality","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical presence in real-time operations may lead to delayed or inadequate response to health and safety hazards","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Remote operation and monitoring may lead to increased risk of contagion spread if proper health and safety measures are not implemented","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate policy and law formulation in urban planning due to lack of consideration for digital fluency and digital rich environments","category":"Policy Formation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on old-school drawing culture and impersonal autocad representations due to contemporary addiction to digital narrative rich television shows and movies","category":"Culture","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential limitations in using 5g and 6g technologies for telemedicine, teleworking, and real-time communication in health sector","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through increased physical interactions in urban areas and cities due to the use of xr technology.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through shared holographic displays","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of infection due to crowded spaces around holographic displays","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of virus transmission through shared touch surfaces on holographic display interfaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of high fidelity mobile holographic capability may lead to increased physical interaction and close proximity among individuals, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of ai and big data in creating super datasets for urban fabrics may lead to data privacy and security risks, potentially exposing sensitive information to unauthorized individuals or entities.","category":"Data Privacy","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to increased physical interaction in urban spaces and events.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards less face-to-face human interactions due to the outbreak of covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid shift to digital technology in architecture education","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Globalization of design studios and classes","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Slowdown in technology advancements due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Technology","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on smart wireless devices in urban areas","category":"Technology","confidence":"High"}]}
